DzUndoStackHold Class Reference
[Basic Types]

Convenience object for automatically starting and ending a hold on the Undo Stack. More...

#include <dzundostack.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Convenience object for automatically starting and ending a hold on the Undo Stack.

It is recommended that you use this object instead of calling DzUndoStack::beginHold(), DzUndoStack::accept() or DzUndoStack::cancel() directly. This is because this object has the benefit of automatically closing the hold, ensuring that the Undo Stack does not get left open inadvertently.

Example:
    void MyClass::doSomething()
    {
        // Create a DzUndoStackHold object - this starts a hold on the undo stack so that
        // undo items will be collected.
        DzUndoStackHold undo;

        ...do something...

        // Stop the collection of undo items and accept the operation. If something goes
        // wrong above, such as an unhandled exception, the destructor of DzUndoStackHold
        // will automatically cancel the operation, insuring that the Undo Stack is not
        // left open.
        undo.accept( "Something" );
    }

Here is another example of a different approach where the object can be used to track the undo stack state, and insure that the undo stack isn't left open forever by the class: 

    void MyClass::startSomething()
    {
        if( m_undoHold != NULL ){
            // the last hold never got closed!
            // delete it here - the destructor automatically cancels the operation if necessary
            delete m_undoHold;
        }
        m_undoHold = new DzUndoStackHold;

        ...start something...
    }

    void MyClass::finishSomething()
    {
        ...finish something...

        if( m_undoHold != NULL ){
            // close off the undo operation
            m_undoHold->accept( "Something" );
            delete m_undoHold;
            m_undoHold == NULL;
        }
    }

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzUndoStackHold::DzUndoStackHold (  ) 

Default Constructor.

Creates an undo stack hold object and starts a hold on the undo stack.

DzUndoStackHold::~DzUndoStackHold (  ) 

Destructor.

Destructor. Cancels the hold on the undo stack if the hold is still open.

Member Function Documentation

void DzUndoStackHold::accept ( const QString &  caption  ) 

Ends the hold, and adds the items to the undostack with the given caption

Accepts the items added to the undo stack and closes the undo stack hold.

Parameters:
caption The caption for the undo operation.
void DzUndoStackHold::cancel (  ) 

Ends the hold, and discards the items.

Rejects the items added to the undo stack and closes the undo stack hold.

void DzUndoStackHold::drop (  ) 

Accepts the actions performed and closes the undo stack hold without adding the items to the undo stack - the memory associated with the items is freed.
